text:
Stefan Lambov Danailov () (9 December 1942 – 27 November 2019) was a Bulgarian actor. He was Minister of Culture of Bulgaria from August 2005 to July 2009. An actor, his best known roles were in "Ladies' Choice", "Affection" and in "Something Out of Nothing".
Danailov died on 27 November 2019 in Sofia of lymphoma, aged 76.
